member.name: F:HardWareInfo.PhysicalMemory.wmi

member.summary: Speed of the physical memory—in nanoseconds.

member.summary: Unique identifier for the physical memory device that is represented by an instance of Win32_PhysicalMemory.

member.summary: Initialization
member.param: DeviceID you can use GPUList to get all Installed GPUs

member.name: M:HardWareInfo.Gpu.#ctor
member.summary: Initialization

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Gpu.Name
member.summary: Label by which the object is known.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Gpu.AdapterDACType
member.summary: Name or identifier of the digital-to-analog converter (DAC) chip. The character set of this property is alphanumeric.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Gpu.AdapterRAM
member.summary: Memory size of the video adapter.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Gpu.Caption
member.summary: Short description (one-line string) of the object.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Gpu.CurrentBitsPerPixel
member.summary: Number of bits used to display each pixel.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Gpu.CurrentHorizontalResolution
member.summary: Current number of horizontal pixels.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Gpu.CurrentNumberOfColors
member.summary: Number of colors supported at the current resolution.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Gpu.CurrentRefreshRate
member.summary: requency at which the video controller refreshes the image for the monitor. A value of 0 (zero) indicates the default rate is being used, while 0xFFFFFFFF indicates the optimal rate is being used.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Gpu.DriverVersion
member.summary: Version number of the video driver.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Gpu.PNPDeviceID
member.summary: Windows Plug and Play device identifier of the logical device.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Gpu.VideoProcessor
member.summary: Free-form string describing the video processor.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Gpu.VideoModeDescription
member.summary: Current resolution, color, and scan mode settings of the video controller. Example: "1024 x 768 x 256 colors"

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Gpu.VideoArchitecture
member.summary: Type of video architecture.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Gpu.GPUList
member.summary: List of GPUs

member.summary: Initialization

member.summary: Initialization

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.NetworkAdapter.Caption
member.summary: Short description of the object

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.NetworkAdapter.Description
member.summary: Description of the object.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.NetworkAdapter.DeviceID
member.summary: Unique identifier of the network adapter from other devices on the system.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.NetworkAdapter.MACAddress
member.summary: Media access control address for this network adapter. A MAC address is a unique 48-bit number assigned to the network adapter by the manufacturer. It uniquely identifies this network adapter and is used for mapping TCP/IP network communications.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.NetworkAdapter.Manufacturer
member.summary: Name of the network adapter's manufacturer.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.NetworkAdapter.Name
member.summary: Label by which the object is known.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.NetworkAdapter.NetConnectionID
member.summary: Name of the network connection as it appears in the Network Connections Control Panel program.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.NetworkAdapter.GUID
member.summary: Globally unique identifier for the connection.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.NetworkAdapter.IsNetEnabled
member.summary: Indicates whether the adapter is enabled or not. If True, the adapter is enabled.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.NetworkAdapter.InterfaceIndex
member.summary: Index value that uniquely identifies the local network interface.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.NetworkAdapter.PNPDeviceID
member.summary: Windows Plug and Play device identifier of the logical device.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.NetworkAdapter.ServiceName
member.summary: Service name of the network adapter. This name is usually shorter than the full product name.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.NetworkAdapter.Speed
member.summary: Estimate of the current bandwidth in bits per second. For endpoints which vary in bandwidth or for those where no accurate estimation can be made, this property should contain the nominal bandwidth.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.NetworkAdapter.NetworkAdapterList
member.summary: List of all Network Adapters

member.summary: Initialization

member.name: M:HardWareInfo.Hdd.#ctor
member.summary: Initialization

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Hdd.BytesPerSector
member.summary: Number of bytes in each sector for the physical disk drive.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Hdd.InterfaceType
member.summary: Interface type of physical disk drive.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Hdd.Caption
member.summary: Short description (one-line string) of the object.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Hdd.Model
member.summary: Manufacturer's model number of the disk drive.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Hdd.FirmwareRevision
member.summary: Revision for the disk drive firmware that is assigned by the manufacturer.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Hdd.MediaType
member.summary: Type of media used or accessed by this device.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Hdd.Index
member.summary: Physical drive number of the given drive.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Hdd.Partitions
member.summary: Number of partitions on this physical disk drive that are recognized by the operating system.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Hdd.PNPDeviceID
member.summary: Windows Plug and Play device identifier of the logical device.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Hdd.SerialNumber
member.summary: Number allocated by the manufacturer to identify the physical media.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Hdd.SectorsPerTrack
member.summary: Number of sectors in each track for this physical disk drive.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Hdd.TotalSizeInBytes
member.summary: Size of the disk drive. It is calculated by multiplying the total number of cylinders, tracks in each cylinder, sectors in each track, and bytes in each sector.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Hdd.TotalCylinders
member.summary: Total number of cylinders on the physical disk drive. Note: the value for this property is obtained through extended functions of BIOS interrupt 13h. The value may be inaccurate if the drive uses a translation scheme to support high-capacity disk sizes. Consult the manufacturer for accurate drive specifications.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Hdd.TotalHeads
member.summary: Total number of heads on the disk drive. Note: the value for this property is obtained through extended functions of BIOS interrupt 13h. The value may be inaccurate if the drive uses a translation scheme to support high-capacity disk sizes. Consult the manufacturer for accurate drive specifications.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Hdd.TotalSectors
member.summary: Total number of sectors on the physical disk drive. Note: the value for this property is obtained through extended functions of BIOS interrupt 13h. The value may be inaccurate if the drive uses a translation scheme to support high-capacity disk sizes. Consult the manufacturer for accurate drive specifications.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Hdd.TotalTracks
member.summary: Total number of tracks on the physical disk drive. Note: the value for this property is obtained through extended functions of BIOS interrupt 13h. The value may be inaccurate if the drive uses a translation scheme to support high-capacity disk sizes. Consult the manufacturer for accurate drive specifications.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Hdd.TracksPerCylinder
member.summary: Number of tracks in each cylinder on the physical disk drive. Note: the value for this property is obtained through extended functions of BIOS interrupt 13h. The value may be inaccurate if the drive uses a translation scheme to support high-capacity disk sizes. Consult the manufacturer for accurate drive specifications.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Hdd.Capabilities
member.summary: capabilities of the media access device. For example, the device may support random access (3), removable media (7), and automatic cleaning (9).

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Hdd.DrivesList
member.summary: List of All Drives

member.name: M:HardWareInfo.Cpu.#ctor
member.summary: Initialization

member.name: M:HardWareInfo.Cpu.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: DeviceID you can use Cpu.CpusList() to get all installed CPUs

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Cpu.ProcessorId
member.summary: Processor information that describes the processor features. For an x86 class CPU, the field format depends on the processor support of the CPUID instruction. If the instruction is supported, the property contains 2 (two) DWORD formatted values. The first is an offset of 08h-0Bh, which is the EAX value that a CPUID instruction returns with input EAX set to 1. The second is an offset of 0Ch-0Fh, which is the EDX value that the instruction returns. Only the first two bytes of the property are significant and contain the contents of the DX register at CPU reset—all others are set to 0 (zero), and the contents are in DWORD format.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Cpu.Revision
member.summary: System revision level that depends on the architecture. The system revision level contains the same values as the Version property, but in a numerical format.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Cpu.Socket
member.summary: Type of chip socket used on the circuit.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Cpu.L2CacheSize
member.summary: Size of the Level 2 processor cache. A Level 2 cache is an external memory area that has a faster access time than the main RAM memory.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Cpu.MaxClockSpeed
member.summary: Maximum speed of the processor, in MHz.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Cpu.NumberofCores
member.summary: Number of cores for the current instance of the processor. A core is a physical processor on the integrated circuit. For example, in a dual-core processor this property has a value of 2. For more information.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Cpu.NumberofLogicalProcessor
member.summary: Number of logical processors for the current instance of the processor. For processors capable of hyperthreading, this value includes only the processors which have hyperthreading enabled. For more information.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Cpu.Manufacturer
member.summary: Name of the processor manufacturer.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Cpu.DataWidth
member.summary: On a 32-bit processor, the value is 32 and on a 64-bit processor it is 64.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Cpu.AddressWidth
member.summary: On a 32-bit operating system, the value is 32 and on a 64-bit operating system it is 64.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Cpu.Architecture
member.summary: Processor architecture used by the platform.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Cpu.DeviceID
member.summary: Unique identifier of a processor on the system.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Cpu.Availability
member.summary: Availability and status of the device.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Cpu.Caption
member.summary: Short description of an object (a one-line string).

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Cpu.Status
member.summary: Current status of the processor. Status changes indicate processor usage, but not the physical condition of the processor.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Cpu.CurrentClockSpeed
member.summary: Current speed of the processor, in MHz.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Cpu.CurrentVoltage
member.summary: Voltage of the processor. If the eighth bit is set, bits 0-6 contain the voltage multiplied by 10. If the eighth bit is not set, then the bit setting in VoltageCaps represents the voltage value. CurrentVoltage is only set when SMBIOS designates a voltage value.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Cpu.Description
member.summary: Description of the object.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Cpu.ExternalClockFreq
member.summary: External clock frequency, in MHz. If the frequency is unknown, this property is set to NULL.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Cpu.Familiy
member.summary: Processor family type.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Cpu.PowerManagementSupported
member.summary: If TRUE, the power of the device can be managed, which means that it can be put into suspend mode, and so on. The property does not indicate that power management features are enabled, but it does indicate that the logical device power can be managed.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Cpu.Name
member.summary: Label by which the object is known.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Cpu.ProcessorType
member.summary: Primary function of the processor.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Cpu.VoltageCap
member.summary: Voltage capabilities of the processor. Bits 0-3 of the field represent specific voltages that the processor socket can accept. All other bits should be set to 0 (zero). The socket is configurable if multiple bits are set. For more information about the actual voltage at which the processor is running, see CurrentVoltage. If the property is NULL, then the voltage capabilities are unknown.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Cpu.L2CacheSpeed
member.summary: Clock speed of the Level 2 processor cache. A Level 2 cache is an external memory area that has a faster access time than the main RAM memory.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Cpu.L3CacheSize
member.summary: Size of the Level 3 processor cache. A Level 3 cache is an external memory area that has a faster access time than the main RAM memory.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Cpu.L3CacheSpeed
member.summary: Clockspeed of the Level 3 property cache. A Level 3 cache is an external memory area that has a faster access time than the main RAM memory.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Cpu.CpusList
member.summary: List of All CPUs

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Cpu.IsMMXSupported
member.summary: The MMX instruction set is available.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Cpu.Is3DNowSupported
member.summary: The 3D-Now instruction set is available.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Cpu.IsSSE3Supported
member.summary: The SSE3 instruction set is available.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Cpu.IsSSE2Supported
member.summary: The SSE2 instruction set is available.

member.name: P:HardWareInfo.Cpu.IsSSESupported
member.summary: The SSE instruction set is available.

member.summary: Type of media that can be used or accessed by this device. Possible values are: CdRomOnly CdRomWrite DVDRomOnly DVDRomWrite Windows Server 2003, Windows XP, Windows 2000, and Windows NT 4.0: Possible values are: Random Access Supports Writing Removable Media CD-ROM
